body:
This enforces parts of the project header include guidelines (added by @sipa in #10575).

Example output:

```
Duplicate include(s) in src/warnings.h:
#include <stdlib.h>

Duplicate include(s) in src/warnings.cpp:
#include <util.h>

Include(s) from src/warnings.h duplicated in src/warnings.cpp:
#include <string>
```

Example run:

```
$ git diff
diff --git a/src/warnings.cpp b/src/warnings.cpp
index c52a1fd..d8994dd 100644
--- a/src/warnings.cpp
+++ b/src/warnings.cpp
@@ -5,6 +5,8 @@

 #include <sync.h>
 #include <clientversion.h>
+#include <string>
+#include <util.h>
 #include <util.h>
 #include <warnings.h>

diff --git a/src/warnings.h b/src/warnings.h
index e8e982c..8d2252e 100644
--- a/src/warnings.h
+++ b/src/warnings.h
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@
 #define BITCOIN_WARNINGS_H

 #include <stdlib.h>
+#include <stdlib.h>
 #include <string>

 void SetMiscWarning(const std::string& strWarning);
$ contrib/devtools/lint-includes.sh
Duplicate include(s) in src/warnings.h:
#include <stdlib.h>

Duplicate include(s) in src/warnings.cpp:
#include <util.h>

Include(s) from src/warnings.h duplicated in src/warnings.cpp:
#include <string>
$ echo $?
1
$ git checkout .
$ contrib/devtools/lint-includes.sh
$ echo $?
0
```
title: Add Travis check for duplicate/redundant includes
